V1-Endpoints-Annotations.description:
Annotations are a way to associate custom and unstructured information to existing API resources. By using
annotations it is possible to store and retrieve client-side data that it is related to existing resources.
For example, Product Plan uses annotations starting with `pp_`-prefixed keys to store information related to UI rendering
preferences and state.

actions.description: Returns the specified association.
actions.name: show

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

view.description: View name with which to render the annotation. If the view param is not specified or does not exist, the annotation will be rendered with the :default view.

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

resource_not_found.description: The requested API resource could not be found for the provided :id

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description: Creates an annotation for a target resource
actions.name: create

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

target_href.description: API href of the resource the association is attached to

key.description: The key that identifies the annotation data

value.description: The associated value of the annotation

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

forbidden.description: The request was a valid request, but the server is refusing to respond to it.

unprocessable_entity.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

created.description: The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

actions.description: Updates the value of an existing annotation.
actions.name: update

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

value.description: The associated value of the annotation

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

forbidden.description: The request was a valid request, but the server is refusing to respond to it.

unprocessable_entity.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

no_content.description: The server successfully processed the request, but is not returning any content.

actions.description: Deletes a single annotation.
actions.name: delete

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

unprocessable_entity.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

no_content.description: The server successfully processed the request, but is not returning any content.

V1-Endpoints-Annotations.name: V1::Endpoints::Annotations

V1-Endpoints-Bars.description:
Bars and containers are the visual representation of items on a roadmap.
These could be initiatives, stories, epics or whatever you want to represent on a roadmap.
A container is a bar with other bars contained in it. Presently only a single level is supported.

actions.description: Returns a list of all bars owned by the authenticated user.
actions.name: index

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

view.description: View name with which to render the bars. If the view param is not specified or does not exist, the bars will be rendered with the :default view.

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

unprocessable_entity.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description: Returns the specified bar.
actions.name: show

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

view.description: View name with which to render the bar. If the view param is not specified or does not exist, the bar will be rendered with the :default view.

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

resource_not_found.description: The requested API resource could not be found for the provided :id

forbidden.description: The request was a valid request, but the server is refusing to respond to it.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description: Updates the specified bar.
actions.name: update

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

description.description: In-depth explanation of what the bar represents.
description.example: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.

strategic_value.example: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.

percent_done.description: Determines the shading of the bar to indicate progress. Null is fully saturated. 0-100 displays a gradual shading until fully saturated.

effort.description: Displays on the bar to indicate the amount of effort needed to complete.

notes.example: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

tags.description: Keywords and terms associated with the bar.

json.body:
{
  "name": "Design",
  "description": "Implement and review the design and produce documentation.",
  "strategic_value": "Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.",
  "percent_done": 82,
  "effort": 5,
  "notes": "Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.",
  "tags": [
    "Design Reviews",
    "Documentation",
    "Prototype"
  ]
}

V1-Endpoints-Roadmaps.description:
Roadmaps contain bars and ideas. A user can have access to one or more roadmaps.
You can get a list of the roadmaps your user has access to.

V1-Endpoints-CustomFields.description:
Custom fields provide the ability to add more information to a bar.
There are currently two custom fields--Lanes and Legends--that can be applied to a bar or idea.
Other custom data will be enabled in the future.

actions.description: Returns a list of all of the roadmap's custom fields.
actions.name: index

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

view.description: View name with which to render the custom fields. If the view param is not specified or does not exist, the custom fields will be rendered with the :default view.

id.description: The custom field's unique database identifier.

V1-Endpoints-ExternalLinks.description:
External Links are outside resources associated with a bar.
They can be web URL's referring to documents, designs, or specifications on other systems
such as DropBox or GoogleDrive. They can also be used to create an integration link between
ProductPlan and another system. ProductPlan integrations include JIRA and Pivotal Tracker and
they are special types which provide synchronizing of percentage complete between those systems
and ProductPlan.

actions.description: Returns a list of all external links owned by the authenticated user.
actions.name: index

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

view.description: View name with which to render the external links. If the view param is not specified or does not exist, external links will be rendered with the :default view.

unauthorized.description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

unprocessable_entity.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description: Creates a new external link.
actions.name: create

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

bar.description: Related bar resource, to which the external link belongs. An external link belongs to exactly one Idea *_or_* one Bar.

idea.description: Related idea resource, to which the external link belongs. An external link belongs to exactly one Idea *_or_* one Bar.

V1-Endpoints-Ideas.description:
Ideas are bars or containers that appear in the Parking Lot.
The Parking Lot is a backlog that allows you to capture ideas and organize them before moving them to the roadmap.

actions.description: Import one or multiple ideas into your roadmap. This endpoint kicks off an asynchronous job and sets the `Location` header in the response, which will point you to where you can retrieve the status of the job (Jobs#show).
actions.name: import

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.

roadmap.description: Related roadmap resource, to which the idea belongs.

description.description: In-depth explanation of what the idea represents.
description.example: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.

strategic_value.example: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.

notes.example: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

percent_done.description: Determines the shading of the bar to indicate progress. Null is fully saturated. 0-100 displays a gradual shading until fully saturated.

tags.description: Keywords and terms associated with the idea.

fields.description: The selected value for each custom field.  `{ roadmap.custom_fields[n].key => value }`

external_links.description: Linked resources external to the idea.

example.name: Design
example.description: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.
example.strategic_value: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.
example.notes: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

example.name: Implementation
example.strategic_value: Test Driven Development leads to a better product.

example.name: Implementation
example.strategic_value: Test Driven Development leads to a better product.

forbidden.description: The user does not have permissions for the specified roadmap.

accepted.description: A job to create Ideas from the given payload has been created and queued for processing. You can retrieve the status of the job from the Jobs#show endpoint. Its URI is specified in the response's `Location` header.

  "name": "Gather Feedback",

  ],

    "pp_legend": "Goal 1",
    "pp_lanes": "Lane 2"
  }
}

V1-Endpoints-Jobs.description: Jobs perform an action in the background and are processed asynchronously. The user who scheduled the job may review the status of the jobs state and when completed, the outcome. Note: The only job currently supported by the API is the Ideas#import endpoint.

actions.description: Returns meta and status information about the specified job. Note: The only job currently supported by the API is the Ideas#import endpoint.

V1-MediaTypes-Bar.name: V1::MediaTypes::Bar

roadmap.description: Related roadmap resource, to which the bar belongs.

start_date.description: Date for which work associated with the bar is to begin.

end_date.description: Date for which work associated with the bar is to end.

description.description: In-depth explanation of what the bar represents.
description.example: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.

strategic_value.example: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.

notes.example: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

percent_done.description: Determines the shading of the bar to indicate progress. Null is fully saturated. 0-100 displays a gradual shading until fully saturated.

effort.description: Displays on the bar to indicate the amount of effort needed to complete.

tags.description: Keywords and terms associated with the bar.

fields.description: The selected value for each custom field.  `{ roadmap.custom_fields[n].key => value }`

external_links.description: The collection of linked resources external to the bar.

child_bars.description: The collection of bars contained by the bar.

timestamps.description: Read-only metadata timestamps for the bar.

created_at.description: Date and time the bar was first created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the bar was last updated.

roadmap.description: API href to the bar's roadmap.

parent_bar.description: API href to the bar's parent bar (container).

child_bars.description: A hash containing the API href for all of the bar's child bars.

external_links.description: A hash containing the API href for all of the bar's external links.

example.name: Design
example.description: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.
example.strategic_value: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.
example.notes: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

V1-MediaTypes-Bar.description:
The schema for a bar/container consists of a set of predefined fields along with two that can be customized,
which represent the Lane and Legend on the roadmap. The start and end dates cannot be modified using the API.
You may adjust those through the user interface.

roadmap.name: Acme Services 5-yr Plan
roadmap.description: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.

example.name: Design
example.description: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.
example.strategic_value: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.
example.notes: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

parent_bar.name: Design
parent_bar.description: Implement and review the design and produce documentation.
parent_bar.strategic_value: Upfront design and documentation leads to a better product.
parent_bar.notes: Rapid prototyping can also help for the UI components.

V1-MediaTypes-Roadmap.name: V1::MediaTypes::Roadmap

description.description: In-depth explanation of what the roadmap represents.
description.example_definition: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.
description.example: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.

owner_email.description: Email of the roadmap's current owner.

custom_fields.description: Custom Fields for the bars in the roadmap.  Fields `:pp_legend` and `:pp_lanes` will always exist.

timestamps.description: Read-only metadata timestamps for the roadmap.

created_at.description: Date and time the roadmap was first created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the roadmap was last updated.

bars.description: A hash containing the API href for all of the roadmap's bars.

ideas.description: A hash containing the API href for all of the roadmap's ideas.

custom_fields.description: A hash containing the API href for all of the roadmap's custom fields.

example.name: Acme Services 5-yr Plan
example.description: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.

V1-MediaTypes-Roadmap.description:
The schema for a roadmap consists of a set of predefined fields, including custom fields
which defines data that can be set on individual bars and ideas.  Currently, the only supported custom
fields are Lane and Legend.  Except for custom fields, roadmaps are currently read-only via the API.

example.name: Acme Services 5-yr Plan
example.description: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.

V1-MediaTypes-CustomField.name: V1::MediaTypes::CustomField

href.description: API path to the custom field.

id.description: The custom field's unique database identifier.

roadmap.description: Related roadmap resource to which the custom field belongs.

key.description: Unique identifier within the custom field's roadmap.

allowed_values.description: Potential values to assign to a bar within the roadmap.

timestamps.description: Read-only metadata timestamps for the custom field.

created_at.description: Date and time the custom field was first created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the custom field was last updated.

roadmap.description: API href to the custom field's roadmap.

V1-MediaTypes-CustomField.description:
The schema for custom fields provides a flexible system to attach unique information to a bar or idea.
There are currently two pre-defined options: Lane and Legend.

roadmap.name: Acme Services 5-yr Plan
roadmap.description: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.

V1-MediaTypes-ExternalLink.name: V1::MediaTypes::ExternalLink

href.description: API path to the external link.

id.description: The external link's unique database identifier.

idea.description: Related idea resource, to which the external link belongs. An external link belongs to exactly one Idea *_or_* one Bar.

bar.description: Related bar resource, to which the external link belongs. An external link belongs to exactly one Idea *_or_* one Bar.

idea.description: API href to the external link's idea, if the link is associated with an idea.

bar.description: API href to the external link's bar, if the link is associated with a bar.

V1-MediaTypes-ExternalLink.description:
The schema for an external link consists of a set of predefined fields,
which allow you to specify URLs to be associated with a bar or idea.

bar.name: Gather Feedback
bar.description: Reach out to customers and gather their feedback on specific questions and open dialog.
bar.strategic_value: Makes our customers happy, leading to increased retention.
bar.notes: Surveys, interviews, including interactive usability meetings.

V1-MediaTypes-Idea.name: V1::MediaTypes::Idea

roadmap.description: Related roadmap resource, to which the idea belongs.

description.description: In-depth explanation of what the idea represents.

strategic_value.example: Test Driven Development leads to a better product.

percent_done.description: Determines the shading of the bar to indicate progress. Null is fully saturated. 0-100 displays a gradual shading until fully saturated.

effort.description: Displays on the bar to indicate the amount of effort needed to complete.

tags.description: Keywords and terms associated with the idea.

fields.description: The selected value for each custom field.  `{ roadmap.custom_fields[n].key => value }`

external_links.description: Linked resources external to the idea.

timestamps.description: Read-only metadata timestamps for the idea.

created_at.description: Date and time the idea was first created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the idea was last updated.

roadmap.description: API href to the idea's roadmap.

external_links.description: A hash containing the API href for all of the bar's external links.

example.name: Implementation
example.strategic_value: Test Driven Development leads to a better product.

V1-MediaTypes-Idea.description:
The schema for an idea consists of a set of predefined fields along with two that can be customized,
which represent the Lane and Legend on the roadmap.

roadmap.name: Acme Services 5-yr Plan
roadmap.description: Acme's roadmap detailing the 5-year feature rollout plan for the Services website.

example.name: Implementation
example.strategic_value: Test Driven Development leads to a better product.

V1-MediaTypes-Job.name: V1::MediaTypes::Job

href.description: API path to the job's status.

owner_id.description: Unique database identifier of the user who initiated the job.

percent_complete.description: The percent of total work completed.

message.description: Additional information about the job's current status

V1-MediaTypes-Job.description: The schema for a job consists of a set of predefined fields which detail meta data about the job. This includes 'state', and if state == "done", the 'outcome'. Note: Currently, the only job created in and supported by the API is done so with the Ideas#import endpoint.

V1-MediaTypes-ApplicationStatus.name: V1::MediaTypes::ApplicationStatus

href.description: API path to the application status.

application.description: Current application state.  Always :up if a 404 or 500 is not returned.

V1-MediaTypes-ApplicationStatus.description: The schema for application status provides meta data about the current application.

target_href.description: Resource href where the privileges are attached

authenticated.description:
Authentication & Authorization

Every request requires a Personal Access Token, or API Token, to authenticate.

This token will map to one specific ProductPlan user. If your account has multipe users, make sure to choose a user who has the appropriate authorization you will need in order to perform the tasks you require of the API.

In the ProductPlan application, navigate to Your Settings (click on your email address in the upper-right), and then API Token (direct link). Follow the instructions for generating the key. Once the 64 character unique hash key is created and displayed, copy it somewhere safe and use it for authentication to the API.

For example, if your generated token is "0c8e87e3e4bb1c3f5c5acfbe7647e7651c31ac3114a67ee8512547e4fc416177", you would use it to authenticate like this: 

Authorization: Bearer 0c8e87e3e4bb1c3f5c5acfbe7647e7651c31ac3114a67ee8512547e4fc416177
Please note that the word "Bearer" must be included in the value and that there is one (and only one!) space between "Bearer" and the token.

Authorization.description: Required to access all API resources.
